org.daisy.dotify.tasks.runner

Class Progress

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.daisy.dotify.tasks.runner.Progress

  • public class Progress
extends Object
    Provides simple progress measuring and reporting. The internal stop watch is started as soon as an instance is created.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Progress()
      Creates a new instance.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Date getETA()
      Gets the estimated time of completion.
      double getProgress()
      Gets the current progress in percent.
      Date getStart()
      Gets the start date, in other words the time of instantiation.
      long timeSinceStart()
      Gets the time since instantiation, in milliseconds.
      void updateProgress(double val)
      Sets the current progress of the operation, in percent.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Progress

        public Progress()
        Creates a new instance. The internal stop watch is started immediately.

    • Method Detail

      • getETA

        public Date getETA()
        Gets the estimated time of completion.
        Returns:
        returns the estimated time of completion

      • getStart

        public Date getStart()
        Gets the start date, in other words the time of instantiation.
        Returns:
        returns the start date

      • updateProgress

        public void updateProgress(double val)
        Sets the current progress of the operation, in percent.
        Parameters:
        val - the current progress, in percent.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is out of range
        IllegalStateException - if the progress is less than or equal to previous reported value.

      • getProgress

        public double getProgress()
        Gets the current progress in percent.
        Returns:
        returns the current progress

      • timeSinceStart

        public long timeSinceStart()
        Gets the time since instantiation, in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        returns the number of milliseconds since instantiation.
